column4: is there a program i can use to burn an avi file to a dvd disc? or at least convert it to iso so i can?
You mean you want to convert the AVI to a DVD video disk(as apposed to a DVD data disk)?
i want to be able to burn an avi file to a dvd disc to be able to play in a dvd player
hmm never done that in linux yet.
i remember in windows i could do it with ashampoo, but thats not available for linux
Brasero has a video DVD option. Tried that?
i tried it said improper file type
What kind of file did it want you to have?
AVI is notg a format. AVI is a container only.
oh how do i figure that out?
AVI can be divx or any number of formats.
not sure, maybe google for brasero dvd video or something. Im sure youll find something. Then you can always reencode it and then make a DVD.
look through Add/Remove in the sound & video stuff.
DeVeDe looks popular in the list.
There ya go Dr Willis uses it and says its good.
